timeline.message: Share containers mapping between IEEE and PSS/E importer

timeline.bodyText: Do we really need this option with PSS/E. It was relevant with IEEE CDF data but is it the case here?
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: For testing purposes it might be interesting as results might be expressed in voltage perunit. If not relevant, I suggest to remove it in another PR
replies.author: JB-H

timeline.bodyText: Maybe for another PR but we should find a more robust way to detect valid raw files.
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: Agreed, need to be more robust.
replies.author: JB-H

timeline.bodyText: See previous comment about the relevancy of this option with raw data.
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: If OK , I will check it in a next pull request
replies.author: JB-H

timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure we don't need to handle per unit? bPerSection in IIDM is in S.
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText: No otherwise the load flow on the IEEE 14 example converges to a bad state.
replies.author: JB-H

replies.bodyText: the IEEE 14 does contain a shunt, so this has been tested
replies.author: JB-H

timeline.bodyText: I would pass the network and containerMapping to createShuntCompensator and get the voltage level inside.
timeline.author: geofjamg
geofjamg

timeline.bodyText:
Licence header should be before the package declaration
year is wrong
timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.bodyText: Like in IEEE importer you should export the imported network to xiidm and then compare to a reference xiidm stored in resources.
timeline.author: geofjamg

timeline.message: new version of psse-converter after feedbacks from code reviewer

Fix code coverage and raw file test duplication

Signed-off-by: Geoffroy Jamgotchian <geoffroy.jamgotchian@rte-france.com>
